doc.title: Rendering engine

value.content: A rendering engine is software that draws text and images on the screen. The engine draws structured text from a document (often HTML), and formats it properly based on the given style declarations (often given in CSS). Examples of layout engines: Blink, Gecko, EdgeHTML, WebKit.

value.title: See also
value.content:
• Web browser engine on Wikipedia
  • Venkatraman.R - Behind Browsers (Part 1, Basics)
